abstracts.cdata!:
The Guyana Water Sector Consolidation
            Project Environmental Guidelines for Construction Projects
            and Environmental Assessment provides contractors with an
            efficient means of complying with Environmental Impact
            Assessment (EIA) and Environmental Management Plan (EMP)
            requirements for projects in the water sector.  The
            guidelines lay out preliminary screening, basic
            environmental and social considerations, environmental and
            social guidelines, implementation, and the reporting format.
            The guidelines then detail environmental screening
            checklists for the major project construction divisions,
            also noting potential negative impacts for each division of
            the project.  Volume 2 is comprised of the Corporate
            Environmental Guidelines for Guyana Water Incorporated
            (GWI).  The corporate guidelines are composed of three
            sections; 1. GWI's mandate and environmental and social
            responsibilities; 2. GWI' s environmental and social
            guiding principles; 3. GWI employees' roles and
            responsibilities.  The guidelines note that GWI's
            mandate is to supply water to the public and its
            responsibilities follow pertinent stipulations of the
            constitution of Guyana, the Environmental Protection Act of
            1996, the National Development Strategy; the Guyana Poverty
            Reduction Strategy of 2001, and the Millennium Development
            Goals of 2000.  Its environmental and social guiding
            principles are based on playing a significant role in
            Guyana's efforts to improve its environmental and
            social situation, and in particular improving health and
            reducing poverty.
